papers.title: Xie Jialin Prize for Outstanding Work in the Accelerator Field, With No Age Limit
authors: Naples University Federico II and INFN
For his pioneering studies on instabilities in particle beam physics
the introduction of the impedance concept in storage rings and
in the course of his academic career
for disseminating knowledge in accelerator physics throughout many generations of young scientists.

papers.title: Nishikawa Tetsuji Prize Talk
authors: For his original work on electron lenses in synchrotron colliders
his outstanding contribution to the construction and operation of high-energy
high-luminosity hadron colliders and for his tireless leadership in the accelerator community.

papers.title: The Hogil Kim Prize
authors: For his demonstration of new experimental technique of phase-stable laser acceleration of protons and ions
in overcoming the challenges to producing high-quality beams and leading the way to realising future medical accelerators.

papers.title: The Mark Oliphant Prize
authors: The Mark Oliphant Prize for a student registered for a Ph.D. or diploma in accelerator physics or engineering
or to a trainee accelerator physicist or engineer in the educational phase of his or her professional career will be based on nominated presentations at the student poster session at IPAC’19.
